snippet: In an introductory course, a professor found that requiring students to ask everyday questions was an effective way to teach economics concepts.
abstract: Robert H Frank Economic View column relates how, in an introductory course on economics, he found that requiring graduate students to ask everyday questions about costs and benefits based on something they have observed or experienced is an effective way to teach economic principles.
lead_paragraph: In an introductory course, a professor found that requiring students to ask everyday questions was an effective way to teach economics concepts.
